page.title: 04HOME FARM
page.content: Home Farm House was built in approximately 1725 of local Cotswold stone. It is a family farm worked with the help of 3 full-time labourers. The land extends beyond our square by some 200 acres given over to cereals and root crops. The rest of the land is intensively managed grassland which supports 250 cows which produce 6000 litres of milk per year per cow. The labourers live in cottages on the main farm complex. The cowman works from 4.45 am to 6.15 pm seven days per week. The other workers work from 7.30 am to 5.30 pm with seasonal variations. The farm has 5 tractors, a forklift truck, bailer, fertilizer spreader, plough, cultivator and silage making equipment. There are no working animals but 3 hunters are kept.
